entry.title: bofedales (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the green colour of bofedales (examples pictured) stands out in the yellow surrounding landscape?

entry.title: Anthony Bennett (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Anthony Bennett is part of a football family, with his father, uncle, cousin, and older brother all playing professionally?

entry.title: Operation South (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Che Guevara was almost killed in the Democratic Republic of the Congo during Operation South?

entry.title: Lore Maria Peschel-Gutzeit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lore Maria Peschel-Gutzeit once advocated for a "right to vote from birth"?

entry.title: a train runs along the roof (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a train runs along the roof at Miami International Airport?

entry.title: Ding Xuesong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ding Xuesong was the first female ambassador of the People's Republic of China?

entry.title: Louise Franklin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that actress Louise Franklin replaced the main dancing role in 1945's Pillow to Post after Dorothy Dandridge was injured in a car accident?

entry.title: history sniffing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that history sniffing has been used to track Papa John's customers?
